attribute.name: Content Type
attribute.description: Controls the formatting of requirements, possible values are: PLAIN (the default) and HTML.

attribute.name: Enable Evaluation
attribute.description: Enables/disables the evaluation of requirements from the document.

attribute.name: Enable Suspicious Calculation
attribute.description: Enables/disables the consideration of the requirements from the document for the caculation of the suspicious state of elements that refer to those requirements.

attribute.name: Show Text Section IDs
attribute.description: Show the IDs of text sections within the GUI and the test reports.

requirement.text: The “Critical auto tests NOK” mode shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The “Power voltage unstable” mode shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The “Executed cycle with delay” modes shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The “Executed cycle” mode shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The “Executed tensioning cycle” mode shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The “No hall effect sensor” mode shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The “Inhibition of all cycles” mode shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The “Inhibition of all cycles by ecu defect” mode shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The “EOL counter inhibition” mode shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The “Inhibition of tensioning” mode shall be updated every 10 ms based on the available information.
The delays for the executed cycles shall be updated every 10 ms.
The status for all modes shall be available on request.
At INIT all cycles shall be checked to have at least one step different from 0xFF.
At INIT first steps shall be checked to have first byte different from 0xFF.
If MMG has been initialized local variable MMG_b8MMGHAsBeenInitialized is B_TRUE) the contexts will be periodically updated.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_CriticalAutotestsNok local function will read the startup Autotest status for setting the MMG_KU32_MASK_CRITICAL_AT_NOT context.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_PowerVoltageUnstable local function will read the Battery voltage survey status for setting the MMG_KU32_MASK_POWER_VOLTAGE_UNSTABLE context.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_ExecutedCycleDelay local function will read the executed cycle delay status for setting the MMG_KU32_MASK_NO_BELTFUNCTIONS_DELAY context.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_ExecutedCycle local function will read the current execute cycle and pyro activation status for setting the MMG_KU32_MASK_NO_BELTFUNCTIONS context.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_NoHallEffectSensor local function will read the Hall Efect Sensor AEC status for setting the MMG_KU32_MASK_NO_HALL_EFFECT_SENSOR context.

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_PowerSupply_AllCycles local function will compute the NVP_stVehicleEquipmentData. Undervoltage and NVP_stVehicleEquipmentData.Overvoltage variables in order to set the MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_ECU_DEFECT_ALL_CYCLES context.

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_EcuDefective_AllCycles local function will read the AEC group status and check if Group mask hardware AEC is set in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_ECU_DEFECT_ALL_CYCLES context.

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_EcuDefective_AllCycles local function will read the AEC group status and check if Group SW/HW Self protection status AEC is set in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_ECU_DEFECT_ALL_CYCLES context.

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_Temperature_EOL_KL30_TensioningCycles local function will read the AEC group status and check if Temperature high AEC is set in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_INHIB_TENSIONING_CYCLES context.

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_Temperature_EOL_KL30_TensioningCycles local function will read the AEC group status and check if EOL low and high AEC is set in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_INHIB_TENSIONING_CYCLES context.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_EOL_Low_Force function will read the AEC group status and check if EOL low and high AEC is set in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_EOL_LOW_FORCE

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_Temperature_EOL_KL30_TensioningCycles local function will compute NVP_stVehicleEquipmentData.UndervoltageAbort variable in order to set MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_INHIB_TENSIONING_CYCLES context.

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_Temperature_EOL_KL30_TensioningCycles local function will compute the NVP_stVehicleEquipmentData.OvervoltageAbort in order to set the MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_INHIB_TENSIONING_CYCLES context.

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_Temperature_EOL_KL30_TensioningCycles local function will read the AEC group status and check if implausible data for buckle signal AEC is set in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_INHIB_TENSIONING_CYCLES context.

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_Temperature_EOL_KL30_TensioningCycles local function will read the AEC group status and check if timeout for buckle signal AEC is set in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_INHIB_TENSIONING_CYCLES context.

mmg_UpdateModeStatus_Temperature_EOL_KL30_TensioningCycles local function will read the AEC group status and check if control steering configuration AEC is set in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_AEC_INHIB_TENSIONING_CYCLES context.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_EOLComfort_BSR local function will read the AEC group status and check if EOL comfort AEC is set in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_EOL_COUNTER_INHIBITION context.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_CriticalAutotestsNok local function will read the last critical autotest ID as an input.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_CriticalAutotestsNok local function will read the status of the last executed autotest as an input.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_PowerVoltageUnstable local function will read the battery voltage status.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_ExecutedCycle local function will read the executed cycle as an input.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_ExecutedTensioningCycle local function will read the executed cycle as an input.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_ExecutedCycle local function will read the pyro activation as an input.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_NoHallEffectSensor local function will notify BMM about restoring the puls counting.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_Temperature_EOL_KL30_TensioningCycles local function will be called in order to check if the battery voltage is outside Normal and Extended Operating range.
Local function mmg_AvailabilityDataStatus will send the AvailabilityDataCategory towards DiagFunction only if it changed from last sta-te
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_SignalReleaseInhibition local function will compute signal release inhibition in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_SIGNAL_RELEASE_INHIBITION context.
Rte_Read_prrCustomerSpecific_b8SignalRelInhibition shall be called to check the value of release inhibition for costumer signals
mmg_CheckCycleEnable local function will write the validity of cycle 0-19.
mmg_ManageModeDelays_ExecutedCycle local function will read the reset cause as an input
mmg_ManageModeDelays_ExecutedCycle local function will read the executed cycle as an input.
mmg_ManageModeDelays_ExecutedCycle local function will read the pyro activation status as an input.
mmg_PreSafe_HandleStateData local function will read the AEC group status in order to set Abortion of a Presafe cycle bit.
mmg_PreSafe_HandleStateData local function will read the AEC group status in order to set Under and Over voltage bit.
mmg_PreSafe_HandleStateData local function will read the AEC group status in order to set Overtemperature bit.
mmg_PreSafe_HandleStateData local function will read the AEC group status in order to set System failure bit.
Local variable mmm_stPreSafeInputData will hold the input signals received from CIL module.
Local variable mmg_u32DeficiencyLevel will hold the deficiency value received from PMP module.
Local variable mmg_u16LocalVoltage will hold the local voltage value received from PMP module.
Local variable mmg_TimeUserData will hold the system time stamp value received from StbM module.
mmg_PreSafe_CheckEOLLimitlocal function will read the EOL counters Autotests status in order to set the Presafe counter bit.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStartData will hold the value of the Start Block and will be saved in RAM when a requested profile is inhibited or started successful
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStopData will hold the value of the Stop Block and will be saved in RAM when a requested profile is ended successful, aborted or inhibited.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData will hold the value of the State Block and will be saved in RAM when a start or stop block is saved.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeManagement. PreSafeBufferID will hold the ID of the Recorder that will be saved in RAM and will be updated every time a recorder is saved.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeManagement.PreSafeState and mmg_stPreSafeManagement. PreSafePreviousState will hold the tensioning state and the previous tensioning state of a executed profile.
If mmg_stPreSafeManagement.PreSafeState and mmg_stPreSafeManagement. PreSafePreviousState are not equal than a new profile is executed and a Presafe Recorder needs to be saved.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData.Start1BuckleSwitch and mmg_stPreSafeStopData.Stop1BuckleSwitch will hold the buckle switch state received from CIL module.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. Start1BeltHandOver and mmg_stPreSafeStopData.Stop1 BeltHandOver will hold the belt hand over state received from CIL module.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData.Start2 PreSafeLvl and mmg_stPreSafeStopData.Stop2 PreSafeLvl will hold the Presafe level received from CIL module.

Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData.Start2 ImpactX and mmg_stPreSafeStopData.Stop2 ImpactX will be set with the value 0x01 if ImpactX signal received from CIL module is 0x01 or will be set with the value 0x00 if ImpactX signal received from CIL module is 0x00.

Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData.Start2 RollOverType1 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData.Stop2 RollOverType1 will be set with the value 0x01 if RollOverType1 signal received from CIL module is 0x01 or will be set with the value 0x00 if RollOverType1 signal received from CIL module is 0x00.

Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData.Start2 RollOverType2 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData.Stop2 RollOverType2 will be set with the value 0x01 if RollOverType2 signal received from CIL module is 0x01 or will be set with the value 0x00 if RollOverType2 signal received from CIL module is 0x00.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. StartVoltage and mmg_stPreSafeStopData.StopVoltage will hold the value of the computed KL15 voltage.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. StartTemperature2 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopTemperature2 will always be set with the value 0x00.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. StartTemperature1 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopTemperature1 will be set with the value 0x00 if deficiency value read from PMP module is lower than 1200.

Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. StartTemperature1 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopTemperature1 will be set with the value 0x01 if deficiency value read from PMP module is equal or higher than 1200 and lower than 32000.

Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. StartTemperature1 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopTemperature1 will be set with the value 0x02 if deficiency value read from PMP module is equal or higher than 32000 and lower than 150000.

Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. StartTemperature1 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopTemperature1 will be set with the value 0x03 if deficiency value read from PMP module is equal or higher than 150000 and lower than 160000.

Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. StartTemperature1 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopTemperature1 will be set with the value 0x04 if deficiency value read from PMP module is equal or higher than 160000.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. StartTemperature1 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopTemperature1 will be set with the value 0x0FF if deficiency value read from PMP module is invalid.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. Start SystemTime1 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopSystemTime1 will hold the first byte of the system time read from the SbtM module.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. Start SystemTime2 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopSystemTime2 will hold the second byte of the system time read from the SbtM module.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. Start SystemTime3 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopSystemTime3 will hold the third byte of the system time read from the SbtM module.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. Start SystemTime4 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopSystemTime4 will hold the fourth byte of the system time read from the SbtM module.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData. Start SystemTime5 and mmg_stPreSafeStopData. StopSystemTime5 will always be set with 0x00 value.
Local variables mmg_stPreSafeStartData, mmg_stPreSafeStopData and mmg_stPreSafeStateData will not set reserved bits and leave them with 0x00 value.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State1TensioningState will be set the value 0x00 if tensioning state received from CIL module is equal to 0x00.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State1TensioningState will be set the value 0x00 if tensioning state received from CIL module is equal to 0x01.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State1TensioningState will be set the value 0x01 if tensioning state received from CIL module is equal to 0x02.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State1TensioningState will be set the value 0x02 if tensioning state received from CIL module is equal to 0x03.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State1TensioningState will be set the value 0x01 if presafe function is disabled or if the cycle requested is disabled.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State1TensioningState will be set the value 0x00 if presafe function is not disabled and if the cycle requested is not disabled.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1PreSafeSupp will be set the value 0x00 if tensioning suppression type received from CIL module is equal to 0x00.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1PreSafeSupp will be set the value 0x00 if tensioning suppression type received from CIL module is equal to 0x01 and ECU location is right.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1PreSafeSupp will be set the value 0x01 if tensioning suppression type received from CIL module is equal to 0x01 and ECU location is left.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1PreSafeSupp will be set the value 0x01 if tensioning suppression type received from CIL module is equal to 0x02 and ECU location is right.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1PreSafeSupp will be set the value 0x00 if tensioning suppression type received from CIL module is equal to 0x02 and ECU location is left.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1PreSafeSupp will be set the value 0x01 if tensioning suppression type received from CIL module is equal to 0x03.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State1PreSafeAbort will be set the value 0x00 if no Timeout or Implausible data AEC is set.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State1PreSafeAbort will be set the value 0x01 if any Timeout or Implausible data AEC is set.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1KL15 will be set the value 0x01 if Ignition signal received from CIL module is different than 0x04.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1KL15 will be set the value 0x00 if Ignition signal received from CIL module is equal to 0x04.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1UvOROV will be set the value 0x00 if Undevoltage and Overvoltage AECs are not set.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State1UvOROV will be set the value 0x01 if Undevoltage or Overvoltage AECs are set.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State2OverTempwill be set the value 0x00 if Self protection AEC is not set.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State2OverTemp will be set the value 0x01 if Self protection AEC is set.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State2SystemFailure will be set the value 0x00 if Hardware AEC is not set.
Local variable mmg_stPreSafeStateData. State2SystemFailure will be set the value 0x01 if Hardware AEC is set.

Local function mmg_PreSafe_CheckEOLLimit will set the mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State2PreSafeCounter local variable with the value 0x00 if the EOL counter mapped on the executed cycle has not reached the maximum value.

Local function mmg_PreSafe_CheckEOLLimit will set the mmg_stPreSafeStateData.State2PreSafeCounter local variable with the value 0x01 if the EOL counter mapped on the executed cycle has reached the maximum value.
mmg_UpdateModeStatus_AllCycles local function will be called in order to check if pyro activation is on and then all Tensioning cycles will be inhibitted.
NvM_GetErrorStatus shall be called in order to get the error status for each block: ExecutionCountersBlock CANInputBlockStatus AECsBlockStatus ServicesRecorder1 ServicesRecorder2
NvM_WriteBlock shall be called in order to write updated blocks
Rte_IsUpdated_prrExecutionCountersBlockStatus_b8NVMBlockStatus shall be called in order to check if execution counters Block has been updated
Rte_IsUpdated_prrCANInputBlockStatus_b8NVMBlockStatus shall be called in order to check if CAN Input signals Block has been updated
Rte_IsUpdated_prrAECsBlockStatus_b8NVMBlockStatus shall be called in order to check if AECs Block has been updated
Rte_IrvRead_MMG_runUpdateNVMBlocks_b8PreSafeRecorder1Update shall be called in order to check if PreSafeRecorder1 Block has been updated
Rte_IrvRead_MMG_runUpdateNVMBlocks_b8PreSafeRecorder2Update shall be called in order to check if PreSafeRecorder2 Block has been updated
If step 0 from a cycle is 0xFF then the return status of validity check shall be ‘B_FALSE’.
If cycle number is not in range then the return status of validity check shall be ‘B_FALSE’.
If step number is not in range then the return status of validity check shall be ‘B_FALSE’.
For each cycle, if Week or Year are 0xFF, then cycle validity is false.
If step duration is over 655350 ms then the return status of validity check shall be ‘B_FALSE’.
mmg_CheckIgnitionON local function will compute signal release inhibition in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_ENABLE_IGNITION_ONcontext.
mmg_CheckCodingOfAPI local function will compute signal release inhibition in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_ENABLE_CODING_API context.
mmg_CheckCodingRBTMFL local function will compute signal release inhibition in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_ENABLE_CODING_RBTMFL context.
mmg_CheckCodingRBTMFR local function will compute signal release inhibition in order to compute MMG_KU32_MASK_ENABLE_CODING_RBTMFR context.
